Metrics used for comparisons should be valid and sufficiently accurate to allow reliable comparisons to be made. This means that measurements should be objective, empirical using a valid scale, and reproducible. • To be objective, there shall be a written and agreed procedure for assigning the number or category to the attribute of the product. • To be empirical, the data shall be obtained from observation or a psychometrically-valid questionnaire. • To use a valid scale, the data shall be based on items of equal value or of a known value.
